newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco approves French firm power deal.
newsitem.headline: Morocco approves French firm power deal.

text.p: Morocco's Casablanca city council on Tuesday unanimously approved a 30-year power and water distribution concession deal to the French firm Lyonnaise des Eaux, officials said.
"The decision has been endorsed by all the 86-member of the city council," they said.
The approval clears the way for the deal to be officially signed soon, they said without setting a date.
The deal would entitle the French firm to take over management of water, electricity and public waste systems "starting from the second half of 1997," they added.
It will commit the firm in long-term development of electricity and water projects to meet consumers' increasing demands, the authorities said.
Officials expected a total investment of 30 billion dirhams, of which one-third would be provided by the French company.
